ns:common.topic.description: DASL was a programming language and compiler proprietary to Datapoint. Primarily influenced by Pascal with some C touches, it was created in the early 1980s by Gene Hughes.\nThe compiler output was assembly language, which was typically processed through a peep-hole optimizer before the assembler and linker.\nReflecting its name, DASL was used for systems programming, mainly by the vendor itself.
rdfs:label: Datapoint's Advanced Systems Language

ns:common.document.text: DASL (Datapoint's Advanced Systems Language) was a programming language and compiler proprietary to Datapoint. Primarily influenced by Pascal with some C touches, it was created in the early 1980s by Gene Hughes.\nThe compiler output was assembly language, which was typically processed through a peep-hole optimizer before the assembler and linker.\nReflecting its name, DASL was used for systems programming, mainly by the vendor itself.

ns:type.object.name: Datapoint's Advanced Systems Language
